summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, scheduling a telephone conference for October 21, 2021, to discuss jury selection matters. It provides public and private dial-in information for the proceeding and reiterates prohibitions against recording or rebroadcasting.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the court order.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued the order scheduling the telephone conference.

events.title: Jury Selection Telephone Conference
events.description: The court schedules a telephone conference to discuss jury selection matters for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The court scheduled a telephone conference for October 21, 2021, to discuss jury selection in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The public and press in the U.S. could access a live audio feed of the proceeding via a provided phone number and access code.
Counsel, the defendant, alleged victims, and family members were to receive a separate, private dial-in number.
The order explicitly prohibits photographing, recording, or rebroadcasting the court proceedings, with potential fines or sanctions for violations.
The document is a formal court order filed on October 19, 2021, in Case No. 20-CR-330 (AJN).
